DataElement.preferredName: CARS 3 How Often Worry About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often they worry about the possibility that their breast cancer could recur, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concerns About Recurrence Scale How Often Worry About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence._A question about how often an individual worries about the possibility that their breast cancer could recur._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

Concepts.definition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

Property.preferredName: How Often Worry About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score

Concepts.longName: How Often Worry About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence
Concepts.definition: A question about how often an individual worries about the possibility that their breast cancer could recur.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Worry Likert Scale Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 3 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 3 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 2 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 2 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 1 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 1 on a scale for the subjective scoring of worry that ranges from 1: I never worry about it to 6: I worry about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How often do you worry about
ReferenceDocuments.description: How often do you worry about the possibility that your breast cancer could recur?

DataElement.origin: CARS: Concerns About Recurrence Scale, Suzanne M. Johnson Vickberg, Ph.D., Ann Behav Med 2003
